data.question: What is the formula of the microporous metal−organic framework discussed in the text?
What method was used for the synthesis of [Zn2(oba)2(bpy)]·DMA?
What is the role of DMA in the structure of [Zn2(oba)2(bpy)]·DMA?
data.answer: DMA acts as a solvent molecule residing in the one-dimensional open channels of the structure.

data.question: How was the stability of the framework [Zn2(oba)2(bpy)]·DMA tested?
data.answer: By heating at 160 °C to remove guest DMA molecules and checking if the structure remains intact.

data.question: What property of [Zn2(oba)2(bpy)]·DMA is utilized for the detection of high explosives?
data.answer: Its unique photoluminescence properties and high selectivity toward nitroaromatics and high explosives.

data.question: What is the effect of nitrobenzene on the fluorescence of [Zn2(oba)2(bpy)]·DMA?
data.answer: Nitrobenzene acts as a fluorescence quencher, reducing the emission by as much as 84%.

data.question: What is the significance of the reduction potentials measured in the electrochemical study of [Zn2(oba)2(bpy)]·DMA and selected analytes?
data.answer: The reduction potentials indicate whether [Zn2(oba)2(bpy)]·DMA acts as an electron donor or acceptor in the presence of group-A or group-B analytes, influencing its fluorescence behavior.

data.question: Why does DMNB show a negligible quenching effect on [Zn2(oba)2(bpy)]·DMA?
data.answer: The size of the pores in [Zn2(oba)2(bpy)]·DMA is too small for a nonplanar, bulky DMNB molecule to enter, and the orbital overlap between DMNB and the MMOF is very weak.

data.question: How does the presence of electron-donating groups in analytes affect the fluorescence of [Zn2(oba)2(bpy)]·DMA?
data.answer: Analytes with electron-donating groups enhance the luminescence emission of [Zn2(oba)2(bpy)]·DMA.

data.question: Is the structure of [Zn2(oba)2(bpy)]·DMA stable upon removal of guest DMA molecules?
Does the fluorescence quenching order of nitroaromatics fully align with the trend of electron-withdrawing groups?
Can [Zn2(oba)2(bpy)]·DMA selectively detect high explosives from different categories?
Is the fluorescence behavior of [Zn2(oba)2(bpy)]·DMA towards DMNB and DNT similar?
Does the presence of electron-withdrawing groups always lead to fluorescence quenching in [Zn2(oba)2(bpy)]·DMA?
Is the fluorescence enhancement observed for group-B analytes due to their electron-donating abilities and vapor pressures?
Does the fluorescence quenching efficiency of nitroaromatics in [Zn2(oba)2(bpy)]·DMA depend solely on the electron-withdrawing strength of the NO2 group?
Are the photoluminescence properties of [Zn2(oba)2(bpy)]·DMA unaffected by nonaromatic nitro-containing analytes?
